newsitem.title: HONG KONG: HK gold closes easier, seen trying lower levels.
newsitem.headline: HK gold closes easier, seen trying lower levels.

text.p: Hong Kong gold closed easier on Friday, extending the decline that set in in New York overnight, and dealers said the yellow metal will try the downside.
Bullion ended at US$341.70/342.20 an ounce against New York's US$342.40/90 close on Thursday and Hong Kong's previous close of US$342.90/343.40.
"Gold slipped in Asia today on a slump in the platinum and palladium prices," a local trading house dealer said. "The U.S. dollar racking up against the yen also pressure the gold."
Dealers saw the market dropping further in coming days and will test downside support at US$340 levels.
Local gold ended HK$10 lower at HK$3,161 a tael.
The carry over charge at the Chinese Gold and Silver
Exchange Society dropped to -5.00 from its previous fix at nil.
